norswap.violin.stream

Class ExtTransformersKt

  • norswap.violin.stream.ExtTransformersKt

  • public class ExtTransformersKt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> Stream<T> after(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,kotlin.Unit> f)
      Returns a stream that yields the same items as this stream, but applying f to each item before yielding it.
      static <T> Stream<T> distinct(Stream<? extends T> $receiver)
      Returns a stream consisting of the distinct items of this stream.
      static <T,K> Stream<T> distinctBy(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends K> selector)
      Returns a stream consisting of items whose selector (as returned by selector) are distinct.
      static <T> Stream<T> drop(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, int n)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, minus its n first items.
      static <T> Stream<T> dropWhile(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> drop)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, minus all the items at the beginning of the stream that match drop.
      static <T> Stream<T> filter(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> keep)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream that match the keep predicate.
      static <T,R> Stream<R> filterMap(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends R> f)
      Returns a stream equivalent to this.filter{f(it)=null}.map{f(it)}, but which evaluates f only once per element.
      static <T,R> Stream<R> fmap(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends norswap.violin.stream.Stream<?extendsR>> f)
      Returns a stream consisting of the results of replacing each item of this stream with the contents of a stream produced by applying f to the item.
      static <T> Stream<kotlin.collections.IndexedValue> indexed(Stream<? extends T> $receiver)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, paired with its index (starting at 0 for the next item of this stream).
      static <T> Stream<T> limit(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, int n)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, with a limit of n.
      static <T,R> Stream<R> map(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends R> f)
      Returns a stream consisting of the results of applying f to the items of this stream.
      static <T> Stream<T> takeWhile(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> keep)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item that doesnt match keep is encountered (this item will not be yielded by the returned stream).
      static <T> Stream<T> then(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, Stream<? extends T> other)
      Return a stream that is the concatenation of this stream with other.
      static <T> Stream<T> upThrough(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> stop)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item matching stop is encountered. The matching item will be the last item of the returned stream.
      static <T> Stream<T> upTo(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> stop)
      Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item matching stop is encountered. The returned stream does not yield the matching item.
      static <T,U> Stream<kotlin.Pair> zip(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, Stream<? extends U> other)
      Returns a stream consisting of pairs made up by one item of this stream and one item of other. The stream only runs as far as the shortest of the two streams.
      static <T,U> Stream<kotlin.Pair> ziplong(Stream<? extends T> $receiver, Stream<? extends U> other)
      Returns a stream consisting of pairs made up by one item of this stream and one item of other. The stream runs as far as the longest of the two streams.

        public static <T,R> Stream<R> map(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                  kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends R> f)

        Returns a stream consisting of the results of applying f to the items of this stream.

                                  kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,kotlin.Unit> f)

        Returns a stream that yields the same items as this stream, but applying f to each item before yielding it.

      • fmap

        public static <T,R> Stream<R> fmap(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                   kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends norswap.violin.stream.Stream<?extendsR>> f)

        Returns a stream consisting of the results of replacing each item of this stream with the contents of a stream produced by applying f to the item.

      • filter

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream that match the keep predicate.

      • filterMap

        public static <T,R> Stream<R> filterMap(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                        kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends R> f)

        Returns a stream equivalent to this.filter{f(it)=null}.map{f(it)}, but which evaluates f only once per element.

      • upTo

        public static <T> Stream<T> upTo(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                 kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> stop)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item matching stop is encountered. The returned stream does not yield the matching item.

      • upThrough

        public static <T> Stream<T> upThrough(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> stop)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item matching stop is encountered. The matching item will be the last item of the returned stream.

      • dropWhile

        public static <T> Stream<T> dropWhile(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> drop)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, minus all the items at the beginning of the stream that match drop.

      • drop

        public static <T> Stream<T> drop(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                 int n)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, minus its n first items.

      • takeWhile

        public static <T> Stream<T> takeWhile(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                      kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,java.lang.Boolean> keep)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, until an item that doesnt match keep is encountered (this item will not be yielded by the returned stream).

      • limit

        public static <T> Stream<T> limit(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                  int n)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, with a limit of n.

      • indexed

        public static <T> Stream<kotlin.collections.IndexedValue> indexed(Stream<? extends T> $receiver)

        Returns a stream consisting of the items of this stream, paired with its index (starting at 0 for the next item of this stream).

      • distinct

        public static <T> Stream<T> distinct(Stream<? extends T> $receiver)

        Returns a stream consisting of the distinct items of this stream.

        Note that this streams holds on to a set of all items seen in the stream

      • distinctBy

        public static <T,K> Stream<T> distinctBy(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                         kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super T,? extends K> selector)

        Returns a stream consisting of items whose selector (as returned by selector) are distinct.

        Note that this streams holds on to a set of all selectors seen in the stream

      • zip

        public static <T,U> Stream<kotlin.Pair> zip(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                            Stream<? extends U> other)

        Returns a stream consisting of pairs made up by one item of this stream and one item of other. The stream only runs as far as the shortest of the two streams.

      • ziplong

        public static <T,U> Stream<kotlin.Pair> ziplong(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                                Stream<? extends U> other)

        Returns a stream consisting of pairs made up by one item of this stream and one item of other. The stream runs as far as the longest of the two streams.

      • then

        public static <T> Stream<T> then(Stream<? extends T> $receiver,
                                 Stream<? extends T> other)

        Return a stream that is the concatenation of this stream with other.
